loans.name: Sègla Augustin

texts.fr: Sègla Augustin est âgé de 36 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Rosaline. Le couple a six enfants dont certains sont scolarisés. Sègla Augustin vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme. Sègla Augustin et sa femme assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Sègla Augustin a très peu fréquenté l'école et a appris la couture. Parallèlement à cette couture, Sègla Augustin vend du thé dans une cafète, depuis dix ans. Sègla Augustin exerce passionnément ce métier, ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. En vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Sègla Augustin sollicite pour la deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Le crédit antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Sègla Augustin is 36 years old and married to a merchant named Rosaline. The couple has six children, some of whom are in school. Sègla Augustin lives together with his children and his wife. Sègla Augustin and his wife provide for the family's various expenses together. Sègla Augustin attended little school and learned to sew. Concurrently with his sewing, Sègla Augustin has sold tea in a cafe for ten years. Sègla Augustin works passionately at his business, which allows him to meet his family's needs without great difficulty. With an eye to satisfying his customers, Sègla Augustin is asking for a second loan from Alidé. His previous loan has been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies, a refrigerator, and cafeteria accessories.

loans.name: Lizzy

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe!  This is 36-year-old Lizzy from Harare.  She is married and has three children, two of whom attend school.  

Lizzy runs a retail business selling clothing and shoes.  The business has been in operation for two years.  She says the main challenge she faces is the lack of a proper place to sell her products.  Lizzy has requested a loan of $500 to buy more clothing and shoes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's standard of living. 

In the future, Lizzy plans to own a big shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire additional sales staff.

loans.name: Alfred M.'s Group

texts.en:
Here we meet with a team of teachers from the township of Waterloo, near Sierra Leone’s capital city of Freetown. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 8,200,000 to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month they will repay the loan, using their salaries. 

Alfred is the featured leader of this team. Born in Yele village, he is 50 years of age. He is married to a trader and the couple has 4 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Alfred has been a professional teacher for 27 years now. He has requested his part of the loan in order to buy house building materials like sand, nails and cement, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house. He will also use part of the loan to invest in agriculture. He will buy seeds to plant palm trees.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like sand, nails and cement, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.  He will also use part of the loan to buy seeds to plant palm trees.

loans.name: Union Y Progreso 6 Group

texts.en:
Rosanny is part of the group named Union y progreso (Union and Progress) 6. She is the representative of this group and has proven to be a very hardworking woman by operating different businesses to make extra income. This group is composed of 5 micro-entrepreneurs. They are doing business in their rural community, outside El Seybo. They sell meat, fruit and vegetables, clothes and other items. 

Rosanny is a young women and she lives together with her parents. She says that her most important challenge is to have a successful business and to become a professional. She enjoys sharing with her family and working. Rosanny sells miscellaneous products like underwear, cosmetics and shoes, either by walking into the nearest communities or directly from her home. She will use this loan to invest in her business and increase her inventory. She is on her 3th loan with Esperanza. Rosanny and her group thank you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products, like cosmetics, shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Scott

texts.en:
While most of Texas saw a problem with the ongoing drought, Scott saw an opportunity.  

Crops and livestock suffer without water, so Scott started the business, Texas Native Rainwater, to help conserve water. Scott designs rainwater harvesting and irrigation systems that store and conserve water, and ultimately save money. 

Texas Native Rainwater also installs rain gardens, a form of “passive” rainwater collection that is essentially a planted, shallow depression that collects run-off from roof surfaces, parking lots, and other surfaces. Its purpose is to retain and treat stormwater and slowly allow it back into the groundwater and ultimately, the aquifer. They also provide consultation and services on tree planting and water reclamation.

Scott started his business in the winter of 2012 and is already making a huge impact on his customers in Austin.  With a small loan from Accion Texas, Scott and his team were able to buy tools and revamp their marketing strategy to get the word out about catching rainwater. This kept the team employed, the family cared for, and the waters preserved.

loans.use: to buy tools and revamp his marketing strategy.

loans.name: Mary V.'s Group

texts.en:
Meet with this group of able and dedicated teachers located in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. They want a loan of SLL of 8,100,000 in order to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial challenges. At the end of each month, their school’s bursar can deduct the amounts they owe to SMT/Kiva lenders from the group's salaries and repay that amount on their behalf. 

Mary is the featured leader of this group of teachers. She is age 59 and a native of Makeni city. Mary is married to a monthly salaried worker and the two of them have 2 children who are no longer attending schools. Mary has been a teacher for 28 years now. She has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials like cement for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like cement for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Ganbaatar, 53 years old, lives with his wife, three sons, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. This extended family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has been rendering taxi service to local people, by renting an automobile from a private business entity for one year. His wife sells clothes, renting a stall at the trade center. His elder son has a position as a welder at a construction company, and his second son plays music at the State philharmonic hall. His daughter-in-law stays at home, looking after her children.

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years, and needs some serious repair. So, Ganbaatar is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT. He will use it to purchase building and insulation materials, such as planks, bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam. Using these materials, he can make an extension, and repair and insulate his house, thus providing more comfortable and warmer accommodations for his family. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke, and thereby contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual, who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: De Cristo La Gloria 1, 2, 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Jhoanna is one of the members of the group called De Cristo la Gloria 1, 2, 4 & 5. They are twenty micro-business women from San Pedro de Macoris, from a batey (a company town) surrounded by sugarcane fields where they live and work for their families. They are selling clothes, miscellaneous products, shoes, groceries, food, etc. Jhoanna lives in a simple home with her family which is comprised of four members: her three children and herself.

Jhoanna is associated with Esperanza and started with us because she needed capital to reinvest in a business. She is very excited to be receiving her 6th loan from Esperanza Internacional after having successfully paid off her previous loans, and having taken steps to grow her business. She has had her business for around five years.

Jhoanna is planning to invest her new loan in purchasing rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, canned food, and other goods for daily meals. She will also buy shoes and other miscellaneous products because she runs different businesses. One is a grocery store and the other is selling shoes and other miscellaneous products. She said her most difficult challenge was to start her business. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy shoes and other miscellaneous products.

loans.name: Isatu B.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of primary school teachers located in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. They have come to SMT to request a loan of SLL 12,900,000 in order to meet their most pressing financial needs. At the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is responsible for managing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Isatu is the featured leader of this group. The 45-year-old is a native of Freetown city. She is married to a teacher and the couple has 4 children – 1 is attending primary school, 2 are in secondary school and 1 is in college. Isatu has been a professional teacher for 17 years now. She has requested this loan in order to pay college/school fees for her children. 

(Also attached on the photo are colleagues/borrowers who collected their loan later on)

loans.use: to pay college/school fees for her children.

loans.name: Aminata B.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers from a primary school situated in Waterloo, a town near Freetown. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 8,000,000 in order to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial needs. At the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for managing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Alieu is the featured leader of this group. The 45-year-old is a native of Masiaka village. He is married to a nurse and he has 12 children – 4 in primary school, 5 in secondary and 3 are not of school-going age. Alieu has been a professional teacher for 18 years now. He is pursuing further studies in college. He has requested this loan in order to pay his college fees.

loans.use: to pay his college fees.

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en: Mr. Myagmarsuren, 54 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His son studies at a technical college, and his daughter goes to high school. He and his family came to Ulaanbaatar five years ago in order to improve their standard of living. They immediately began their business selling Mongolian traditional gers (portable felt dwellings) after settling in Ulaanbaatar. He is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy raw materials, such as planks and felts. Using these materials, he can continue to make Mongolian traditional gers without worrying about shortages of raw materials. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy planks and felts for his business of making and selling Mongolian traditional gers (portable felt dwellings).

loans.name: Estrelieta

texts.en: Estrelieta is married and has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Estrelieta is 33 years old and has three children in school. She has a general store business in the Philippines. Estrelieta applied for a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, including coffee, milk, rice, soap, bread, shampoo and other groceries. Estrelieta has been in this business for two years. In the future, Estrelieta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, including coffee, milk, rice, soap, bread, shampoo and other groceries.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell in her business. Evelyn has been in this business for eight years. Evelyn earns additional income from a general store and from buying and selling charcoal. Evelyn has been maintaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Francis F.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of hardworking and dedicated primary school teachers who are based in Grafton, on the outskirts of Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Staff of various institutions normally come to SMT to request for loans in order to meet their most immediate financial needs. At the end of each month, they use their salaries to repay the loan. Their bursar is directly responsible for deducting their repayments and paying SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf.

Francis is the featured leader of this team. A native of Kailahun, Francis is married to a housewife and he has 9 children who are attending primary, secondary and tertiary academic institutions. Francis has been a school teacher for 35 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials like iron corrugated sheets, sand, nails and cement, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house for his family.

loans.use: to buy house building materails like iron corrugated sheets, sand, nails and cement, etc. for the constructions of a dwelling house for his family.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: A loan of USD1,000 is being offered to Angelina to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies, such as biscuits, noodles, sugar and coffee, and a refrigerator to keep drinks cold. She has been involved in business activities since 2008. She feels very comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Angelina independent, because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies, such as biscuits, noodles, sugar and coffee, and a refrigerator to keep drinks cold.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business fishing, and buying and selling fish, in the Philippines. Gloria applied for a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell. Gloria has been in this business for 21 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now applying for a new loan to further build her fish-vending/fishing business. In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a chocolate-making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years.

Guillerma requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.  She will use the loan to purchase additional ingredients for her chocolate-making business. She would like to save enough money for future expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her chocolate-making business

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years, now.

Irma requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her food preparation business. Irma would like to save enough money for future expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Yane

texts.en:
This is Yane, a 44-year-old woman who is married to Eben, a 48-year-old man. They are blessed with 4 children, namely: Yeti, 20, who is studying at a nursing academy; Yano, 18, who has graduated from senior high school; Sira, 14, in the 2nd grade of elementary school, and Inda, who is 3 years old.

Yane owns a kiosk business, selling daily needs products like cooking oil, sugar, coffee, soap, etc. In her spare time, Yane sews tablecloths, window and door curtains and then sells them. Recently, she had to pay her daughter education fees for the new semester registration. 

Unfortunately, now she cannot restock her kiosk business as she has spent all the money for her daughter’s education.Yane has requested a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 from TLM to complete stocking her kiosk and to pay Yano’s education fees to university.

loans.use: to purchase kiosk stock like cooking oil, milk and soap, etc. and to pay Yano’s education fees to the university.

loans.name: La Reforma 2, 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Agustide is the coordinator of his group, La Reforma 2, 4, 5 "Reform". This is a group of Haitian citizens who are now located in an area of San Pedro de Macoris, a town where the economy is based on the sugar cane industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water. The water is not potable. 

Agustide makes his home in a simple structure with his 4 children. He says that his most difficult challenges have been settling in a foreign city and helping his family. He plans to continue doing business and enjoying the time he spends working. He is excited to be taking out his 12th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and growing his business. He has had his business for 8 years, starting with a fruit and vegetable stand. He plans to use this loan to purchase cosmetics, shoes and clothes to sell. He will use the profits to reinvest and to provide for his children. He is dreaming of improving his business and returning to Haiti to start a good business there.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Olga Yamile

texts.es:
Olga de 30 años de edad, es una mujer dedicada a su hogar y con grandes aspiraciones en la vida, el deseo de convertirse en microempresaria la ha llevado a solicitar un crédito con el fin de capacitarse en cocina básica y comenzar con la venta de comidas desde su hogar, debido a que en la actualidad se dedica a oficios varios, actividad muy mal remunerada y de mucho agotamiento físico.

Sueña con mejorar su condición económica y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Olga, 30, is a woman who is dedicated to her home and has great aspirations in life. The wish to become a microentrepreneur has brought her to request a loan in order to train herself in basic cooking and start selling food from her home. She currently makes a living in various trades, which is very poorly paid and very physically exhausting.

She dreams of improving her economic condition and offering her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: pay for training in basic cooking

loans.name: Sandra Lorena

texts.es:
Sandra, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo en el trabajo de avon, ya que los créditos son una fuente generadora de ingresos para los comerciantes; este le permitirá comprar lociones, rolos, tintes, maquillajes, entre otros productos. 
El crédito anterior le permitió incrementar las ventas y asimismo aumentar la clientela por la buena mercadería que ella brinda; las circunstancias familiares no han cambiado y las condiciones económicas se mantienen.
texts.en: Sandra is requesting a new loan due to her need to continue investing in her work with Avon, since the loans are a source of income generation for business people. This will allow her to buy lotion, hair rollers and dye, makeup and other products. Her prior loan allowed her to increase her sales as well as increasing her clientele due to the good merchandise that she offers. Her family circumstances haven't changed and her economic condition has remained the same.

loans.use: to buy lotion, hair rollers and dye, and other products.

loans.name: Ae

texts.en:
Ae, 31, is married to Esty, 25. They are blessed with two lovely children:  Jhon, one year old and Joana 1 month old. 

Ae is a musician. He is skillful in several instruments like guitar, keyboard, and saxophone. In order to generate money for his family, Ae provides private music courses at his house. 

As an eldest brother, Ae also assists his brother, Yeskiel, in paying his education fees. At the moment, Ae needs money to pay research fees for his brother's thesis and to buy a saxophone.

loans.use: to pay research fees for his brother's thesis and to buy a saxophone.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Imelda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Imelda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like paints, wood, etc. for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like paints, wood, etc. for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Irein

texts.en:
Irein is 27 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Irein works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, soap, sugar, noodles, etc. in her general store. Irein has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Irein would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, soap, sugar, noodles, etc. for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chips and soft drinks for his business.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
This is Hilda, 41, a resident of Taguig, Philippines, married to Edison, a driver, and a mother to her children. She and the children manage her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Hilda operates a food stall selling snacks like banana cue, a popular snack food in the Philippines consisting of deep-fried bananas coated in caramelized brown sugar. Banana cue is made from Saba bananas, usually skewered on a bamboo stick, and sold on the streets. She is also a tricycle operator. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan to buy bananas, sugar, oil and gas.

Hilda hopes that her business will expand soon and dreams of having a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, sugar, oil, and the gas needed in her other business.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a welding shop business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years now.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her shop. In the future, Amina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her shop.

loans.name: Sarma

texts.en:
Sarma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years, and earns more income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her fishing business like paints and woods, etc. for her fishing boat. 

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her fishing business, like paints and wood, etc.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Juvy, a married mother of five children from Bien Unido, Bohol, has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than 13 years now. This is their sole source of income. Juvy is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat. Through this, her husband will be able to expand the catch they can sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Francisco Serrato Group

texts.es: Doña Sofía es originaria de una comunidad indígena Mazahua. Comenta que ella era parte de otro grupo pero que desgraciadamente una integrante quedo mal y ella hizo su propio grupo para poder pedir un crédito e invertirlo en su pequeño negocio. Dice que desde hace 3 años tiene un negocio en su casa de venta de dulces, refrescos, frituras y que en su casa tiene un puesto ya que por ahí viven muchos niños y para poder ganar algo de capital ella vende, dice que puso el negocio porque  su esposo ya esta grande y no le alcanza con lo que le da para la alimentación y porque con ella vive una nieta la cual estudia la secundaria y doña Sofi, como le llaman, le ayuda a pagar sus estudios. Es por eso que ella está pidiendo su crédito porque quiere surtir su negocio de dulces y frituras para que pueda tener ganancias y así ayudarle a su nieta a concluir su secundaria. Los otros tres integrantes del grupo se llaman Hortencia, Alicia y Martha ellas invertirán en la compra de dulces, refrescos, frituras, para la compra de artículos para tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en: Ms. Sofia is originally from of a native american community of the Mazahua. She says that she was a part of another entrepreneurial group, but unfortunately one of the members was unreliable, so she formed her own group to be able to ask for a credit and invest it in her small business. She says that for 3 years she has run a business from her home selling sweets, refreshments and fried foods. And because her house has a reputation because there are many children who live in her area and she can earn a little bit of money from what she sells. She says she started her business because her husband is a big man and she needs to be able to feed him more and also because she lives with her granddaughter who is in high school and Ms Sofia helps her pay for her school expenses. This is why she is asking for a credit, because she needs to stock her business with sweets and fried foods so she can earn more money and be able to help her granddaughter finish school. The other three members of the group are named Hortencia, Alicia and Martha and they will invest their credit in purchasing sweets, refreshments, fried food and to purchase grocery items for their grocery store.

loans.use: purchase sweets, fried foods and refreshments.

loans.name: Allah Joy

texts.en:
Allah Joy works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. She has been sustaining her business activities through her loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further enhance her general store and her charcoal business. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like soap, sugar, milk, coffee, canned goods, etc. in her general store business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soap, sugar, milk, coffee, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Yaneth María

texts.es:
Yaneth de 37 años, es madre de dos hijos menores de edad, se dedica a laborar como empleada del servicio en una casa de familia, actividad que complementa con la venta de postres y productos de panadería, con el fin de generar los ingresos para el sostenimiento y la educación de sus hijos. 
En la actualidad desea capacitarse en la elaboración de productos a base de quesos y calados, con el propósito de montar su propio negocio e independizarse; razones que la han motivado a solicitar un crédito ya que no cuenta con recursos propios para realizar dicha inversión. 
Sueña con tener una vivienda propia y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Yaneth is 37 years old, has two younger children and she currently works as a domestic laborer for a family, an activity that she complements with the sales of cakes and bakery goods; with the goal of making enough money to support herself and for the education of her children. Currently, she wants to get training for making items like cheeses and a type of bread called "calado" so she can open her own business and be self employed. The reason she wants to ask for this credit is that she doesn't have her own resources to invest in making a business. She dreams to have her own home one day and to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: get training for making cheeses and bread.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
As a married parent of twelve children, Demetria works hard to support her family. She has an ambulant dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and fishing. 

Demetria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF.  She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 56 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children, who are in school. Lucia is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lucia has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF, to finance her business activity. She would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es:
Pedro es originario del municipio de Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí, de oficio agricultor, casado tiene 2 hijos, con las edades de 24 y 23 años. El inicio sus actividades en hortaliza hace 3 años a la edad de 44 años, un amigo lo convenció de que cultivaran tomate les fue bien y desde entonces se dedica a esta actividad.
En su negocio lo apoyan sus hijos y su esposa. Su producto lo comercializa en Managua. Tiene otros ingresos provenientes de la venta de leche ya que cuenta con una vaca parida que le da leche. Le gustaría vender su producto a los supermercados porque le pagarían a un mejor precio su producto. Las expectativas que tiene de su negocio son ampliar el área de siembra y obtener buenos rendimiento y precio justo por el producto. El préstamo lo solicito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes foliares y pesticidas para cultivar media manzana de tomate. El estima que este crédito le ayudara mucho porque podrá cultivar  con una mejor calidad y sacar buenos rendimientos sus planes futuros son compra de más tierras para ampliar el área cultivada. Sus metas próximas son mejorar su vivienda y compra de una vaca parida.
texts.en:
Pedro is originally from the municipality of Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí, and a farmer by trade. He is married and has two children, ages 24 and 23. He began his horticulture career three years ago, at the age of 44, when his friend convinced him that cultivating tomatoes had gone well for him, and since then he has been making a living in this business.

His wife and children support him in his business. He sells his products in Managua. He has other income from selling milk, since he has a calving cow that provides him with milk. He would like to sell his products in the supermarkets because they would pay him a better price for his products. 

He expects his business to expand in the area of sowing and to obtain good yields and a fair price for his products. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of fertilizer, foliar fertilizer (type of fertilizer that is mixed with water and applied directly on the plant's leaves), and pesticides to cultivate almost an acre of tomato plants.

He believes that this loan will help him a lot because he will be able to cultivate with better quality and get good yields. His future plans are the purchase of more land to expand the area he cultivates. His next goals will be to improve his home and buy another calving cow.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, foliar fertilizer, and pesticides to cultivate almost an acre of tomato plants

loans.name: Yurani Andrea

texts.es:
Yurani, es ama de casa y madre de dos hijos menores de edad, se dedica al oficio de la confección desde hace algunos años, pero en la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en capacitarse en la elaboración de carnes frías con el fin de alternarlo con el oficio de confección y mejorar los ingresos para su hogar.
Asegura que ve viable y rentable el negocio de carnes frías y por lo cual desea capacitarse y abrirse camino el mundo comercial. Sueña tener una estabilidad económica y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Yurani is head of the household and mother of two younger children. She has been in the business of sewing for a few years, but now she is looking for a credit that she will invest in getting the training necessary for making cold cuts, with the goal of alternating this activity with that of sewing and to improve her earnings she takes home. 
She assures us that she thinks her new business is viable and sustainable and that is why she wants to get the training and open a new path into the commercial world. Her dream is to have a stable economy and to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: training for making cold cuts.

loans.name: Beverlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Beverlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Beverlyn is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Beverlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 52 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. Edna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soap, sugar, and other groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 8 years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soap, sugar, and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 56 years old and widowed with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like sugar, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, etc. to sell.

She has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. Elizabeth has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like sugar, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Julio Adalberto

texts.es:
Julio, se dedica a la reparación de relojes, celulares y venta de accesorios. Vive con su esposa, dos hijos de 7 y 10 años de edad, no posee familiares en el extranjero. Julio, inicio esta actividad en el año de 1993, hoy en día cuenta con más clientela y su negocio se ha ampliado.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar carcasas y estuches de celulares, baterías, relojes, entre otros  productos para el negocio; este le ayudara al fortalecimiento del mismo, ya que adquirirá lo necesario para darle un mejor servicio a los clientes.
Su sueño es comprar una parcela de tierra en otra lugar.
texts.en: Julio repairs watches, cell phones and sells phone accessories. He lives with his wife and his two children who are 7 and 10 years old. He does not have any family living abroad. Julio began this business is 1993 and today he has more clients and his business has grown. The loan he is asking for will allow him to purchase cell phone cases, batteries, watches and other products for his business. This will help him to strengthen his business because he will be able to get what he needs to provide a better service to his customers. His dream is to purchase a patch of land in another location.

loans.use: purchase cases for cell phones, batteries, watches and other items.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Julia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish selling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Julia is requesting PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her business.

Julia has been sustaining her business activities through 3 prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
This is Bella. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more fruits and vegetables needed for her business. It also helped in her everyday expenses as well as in the education of her children. She has been in this business for thirteen years. She and her husband work hard to provide income for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan so she can purchase more fruits and vegetables needed for her business. Her profits from her business will help her sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Bella's dream is for her business to continuously grow and she is hoping that her family will always help one another. She meets every week with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay back microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for various fruits and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty is 53 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming coconuts in the Philippines. Letty is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to pays for laborer's salaries for her coconut farm.

Letty has been farming coconuts for 3 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut meat and herbal medicine.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pays for laborer's salaries for her coconut farm

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Alma successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Alma's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is a 62 year old married woman and a mother of three children from Trinidad, Bohol in the Philippines. She has run a shoe repair shop for more than 15 years. Her husband works as a carpenter and farmer.
 
Maxima is asking for a loan to buy materials for shoe repair like thread and nylon, needles, polish and more. Through this, she will be able to cater to more shoe repair requests from her customers thus augmenting her income. Moreover, she dreams of expanding her business and makes it a success.

loans.use: to buy materials for shoe repair such as thread and nylon, needles, polish and more

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
This is Juliet, 54, a resident of Taguig, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Luciano and a mother to their children. She and her husband are managing the household, while operating the business. She continually provides income for their everyday expenses.  

Juliet operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings, when all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons, when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Juliet's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales, every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, in larger quantities. She expects a boost in her business income, as she expands her business. 
 
Juliet wants to have a bigger income from her business, so she can have their own house. She dreams to give her family a bright future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients, like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Éctor

texts.es:
Ector, de oficio agricultor, originario de Condega, municipio de Estelí, padre de 4 hijos. Él dice que su crédito anterior le ayudo para  comprar maíz al por mayor obtuvo rendimientos aceptables aunque el precio del producto está muy bajo logro sacar los costos de producción y granos para el autoconsumo. El siguiente préstamo lo quiere para la compra de maíz y compra de abono, insecticidas y fertilizantes  para cultivar una manzana de frijol. 

El considera que este crédito le ayudara mucho para incrementar sus ingresos y obtener seguridad alimentaria para su familia y la comunidad ya que contara con el grano en época de escasez Una vez finalizado el pago de este crédito su siguiente paso sería solicitar otro para cultivar una manzana de maíz.
texts.en:
Ector, a farmer by trade, is originally from Condega, in the municipality of Estelí. He is the father of four children. He says that his previous loan helped him buy wholesale corn and obtain acceptable yields, even though the price of the product is very low he was able to calculate his production costs and the cost of basic grains for self-consumption.

He wants the next loan for the purchase of corn, compost, insecticide and fertilizer to cultivate 7000 square meters of beans. He thinks this loan will help him a lot to increase his income and obtain food security for his family and community, since he will have basic grains in the period of shortages. Once he has paid off this loan his next step will be to request another to cultivate 7000 square meters of corn.

loans.use: to buy corn, compost, fertilizer and insecticide to cultivate 7000 square meters of beans

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
This loan will help Rafael improve the efficiency of his video store.

Rafael has worked at Heights of Video Entertainment since he was a 13-year-old teenager growing up in Brooklyn. Two years ago, Rafael bought the business and assumed full ownership. Heights of Video Entertainment sells and rents DVDs and Blu-Rays, employs two individuals, and strives to keep the movie rental culture alive. Rafael has built a very high reputation for the store, and his many customers are loyal and happy to have a traditional video store with knowledgeable employees. 

Rafael now wants to improve the efficiency of his business. This loan will allow Rafael to update his computer system to better organize and manage his store.

loans.use: to update his computer system to make his business more efficient.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a website and fulfill client orders that were backed up due to Hurricane Sandy.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana, 63, is a married woman and has two children. Her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a dress- and rug-making business in the Philippines. Luciana has been in this business for 15 years.

Luciana requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF.  She will use the loan to buy more materials for making rugs and dresses, like fabric and thread. She would like to save enough money for future expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making rugs and dresses, like fabric and thread

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
This loan will help Steven take his music to the professional level and release a new album.

Steven has been involved in the music business for 15 years. He is a vocalist and guitar player and plays at local venues, bars, beach bars, restaurants, hotels, and coffee shops around South Florida six or seven nights a week. He began his own business, Steven Ross Entertainment LLC, one year ago to take his passion for music to the professional level. 

Listen to Steven’s music here: www.bushwoodband.com 

In the process of producing a new album, Steven needs a loan to rent a rehearsal space for his band, as well as to purchase production equipment.

loans.use: to purchase production equipment and rent out a rehearsal space for his band.

loans.name: Billy

texts.en:
Billy opened his business, Varsity Sportswear Inc., more than 15 years ago. He has been selling sportswear to a variety of local colleges, high schools and athletic teams, but his business had reached a plateau. He needed to make an investment to reach a new level. 

The first step was to diversify his product line. Varsity Sportswear now offers school logo sportswear, as well as accessories, such as North Face duffel bags and backpacks, luggage sets, socks, mugs, hats, license plate holders and other items. The full inventory is available on the company’s website: www.vsportswear.com  

To accommodate his increased inventory, Billy applied for an Accion Texas Inc. loan so he can transfer his inventory to a bigger warehouse and pay a Certified Public Accountant. Billy also plans to use the funds to advertise his product line.

loans.use: to transfer his inventory to a bigger warehouse, pay a Certified Public Accountant, and to advertise his products.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela works hard to support her family. Marcela is married and has a business, buying and selling coconuts, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Marcela requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more coconuts to sell. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to resell

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Loreta works hard to support her family. She has a business, buying and selling gasoline in the Philippines. She earns additional income by fishing and raising chickens.

Loreta is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream -- to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a food preparation and vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years. She earns additional income by buying and selling pigs.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her foods. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money and expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food preparation business

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 56 years old, married, and has six children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 16 years, and she earns additional income from food vending.

Corazon is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream -- to save enough money to rebuild and expand her pig sty.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maylinda

texts.en:
Maylinda has been earning a living through her food vending business for more than 12 years. She sells home-cooked snack foods, like tempura and fruits, in her place in Bien Unido, Bohol. Maylinda works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her children.

Maylinda is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients for making tempura to sell, like flour, oil, seasonings and other food products. Through this, she will be able to sell more and augment her income. Furthermore, she hopes to save up money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for making tempura to sell, like flour, oil, seasonings and other food products

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco. La socia es la Sra. Lisbeth; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales, ella cría los animales como pollos y cuyes y luego los hace engordar y luego los vende en forma ambulatoria y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener un local poara vender sus animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y pollos.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Lisbeth is a member of the communal bank “San Isidro de Yanahuara”. The bank is located in the District of Urubamba, in the Province of Urubamba and the Department of Cusco. Lisbeth is 33 years old and lives with her partner and two children. She splits her days between her daily activities and her business of raising animals. She raises animals such as chickens and guinea pigs, fattening them up and then selling them from place to place. Her business allows her to provide for her children. Lisbeth would like to have a commercial location from which to sell her animals.

Lisbeth is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens. She says that she is happy for the loan and that she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan,38 años de edad, de oficio agricultor ,originario de  Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Esteli , casado padre de 4 hijos de  18,14,12y 5 años de edad respectivamente, se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas y tabaco empezo desde muy joven pues su familia se dedica a los mismo la mayoria de sus productos los vende en la misma zona donde habita. El esta solicitando el credito para la compra de abonos solubles, fertilizantes y mano de obra para darle un buen mantenimiento a ½ manzana de chiltoma. Este financiamiento será de gran beneficio  porque le dará buen manejo al cultivo necesario para lograr obtener buenos rendimientos, mejores ingresos para la familia y el negocio. Podrá  ampliar su vivienda y el área de cultivo de tomate y chiltoma. Al finalizar el pago de este crédito  su siguiente paso sería seguir sembrando tomate, chiltoma y tabaco de manera escalonada para obtener ingresos en todo el año.
texts.en:
Juan, 38 years old, in the trade of agriculture, is originally from Pueblo Nuevo in the municipality of Esteli. He is a married father of four children who are 18, 14, 12, and 5 years of age respectively. He sows vegetables. He began very young since his family makes a living in the same way. He sells the majority of his products in the same area where he lives. 

He is requesting the credit to buy soluble compost, fertilizers, and pay labor costs to allow him to maintain a half block of chiltoma peppers. This financing will be a great benefit because it will allow him to manage the crop necessary to be able to obtain a good yields and a better income for the family and the business.

He will be able to expand his home and his area for the cultivation of tomato and chiltoma peppers. When he finalizes the pay for this loan, his next step would be to continue sowing tomatoes, chiltoma peppers, and tobacco in steps to earn an income all year.

loans.use: to purchase soluble compost, fertilizer, and labor cost.

loans.name: Evila Estela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Evila, se dedica  a la venta de tortillas y pan. Ella vive con su hija, dos nietos de 6 y 8 años de edad; el oficio lo realiza todos los días y tiene una persona que le ayuda el cual le paga $80.00 mensuales.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar maíz, leña, gas propano, pan francés y pan dulce; este le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio y obtener ingresos; no enfrenta ningún riesgo en el producto, ya que este es perecedero y  todo lo hace para el día. 
Su objetivo es adquirir material para tenerlo de reserva para la época de invierno y su sueño  es darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y obtener utilidades.
texts.en:
Evila sells tortillas and bread. She lives with her daughter and two grandchildren, who are 6 and 8 years old. She works every day and has a helper whom she pays $80 a month. She does not face any risks in the products she sells because they are perishables and she makes what she needs each day.

Her goal is to acquire supplies to hold in reserve for the winter season. Her dream is to provide a better quality of life for her family and to make a profit.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, propane gas, french bread and "pan dulce" (a Salvadoran pastry)

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a 35-year-old farmer, from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and and has five young children. Rosie has been engaged in a farming business for more than 10 years. This is her main source of income.

Rosie is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her farm and her harvest. In the future, Rosie hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Juliana mujer de 59 años, soltera con cinco hijos  todos mayores, desde hace 15 años su negocio es la venta de enchiladitas leonesas por mayor la cual las distribuye a minoristas vendedores en la capital, tiene cinco años de ser cliente de la institución que a demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de enchiladas leonesas al por mayor, Tomasa tiene 59 años de edad y su negocio es venta de pizzas y Yamileth tiene 42 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three entrepreneurial women. One of them, Juliana, is a 59 year-old single woman with five adult children. For 15 years, her business has been selling Leonese enchiladas wholesale. She distributes to smaller merchants around the capital. She has been a client of ADIM for five years and has shown herself to be timely in her repayments. She will invest this loan in the wholesale purchase of Leonese enchiladas.

Tomasa is 59 years old and she sells pizza. Yamileth is 42 years old and sells new clothing.

loans.use: to buy Leonese enchiladas wholesale, for distributing to markets around the capital

loans.name: Lissette Mercedes

texts.es:
Lissette, se dedica a la venta de productos básicos y venta de plásticos. Ella vive con su familia, su esposo de 46 años de edad, dos hijos de edades de 19 y 25 años, su nieta de 2 años de edad, todos dependen de los ingresos del negocio; dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años, lo lleva a cabo todos los días de 7:00 am a 8:00 pm con su esposo y un hijo.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá invertir en la comprar de maíz, arroz, frijol, azúcar y en mercadería de plásticos tales como: guacal, vasos, platos, entre otros; este le ayudara para el fortalecimiento de su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Su sueño es seguirle ayudando a su hijo en el estudio para que sea un profesional.
texts.en:
Lissette works selling basic products and plastics. She lives with her family: her husband who is 46 years old, two children who are 19 and 25 years old, and her granddaughter, who is 2 years old. All of them depend on the income from the business. This activity she has performed for 10 years. She performs her work every day from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. with her husband and one child.

The loan she requires will allow her to invest in the purchase of corn, rice, beans, and sugar, and in plastic merchandise such as: bowls, glasses, and plates, among others. This will help her to strengthen her business and satisfy the necessities of her customers.

Her dream is to continue helping her son in his studies to be a professional.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, beans, sugar, and plastic merchandise such as: bowls, glasses, and plates, among others.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is divorced and has two children. After successfully graduating primary school, Mary is now an established businesswoman. She prepares and sells ‘Banku’ for a living (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste). 

Mary usually sells her ‘Banku’ in Afosua (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for a number of years. As the sole breadwinner, Mary uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Mary will use the loan to purchase supplies of maize and cassava, which will help her to improve overall ‘Banku’ sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase maize and cassava, to help with her ‘Banku’ sales.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de ropa, pupusas, siembra de maíz y frijol. Ella vive con su familia, su mama de 70 años de edad y su hijo de 15 años de edad, todos dependen de su negocio y no tiene familiares en el extranjero. María realiza la venta de ropa
 durante la mañana, en la tarde va a observar y trabajar en la siembra de los granos básicos y por las noches lleva a cabo la elaboración y venta de pupusas.
El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá en compra de variedad de ropa, fertilizantes tales como: abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros; este le permitirá fortalecer el negocio, obtener mejores ganancias y las utilidades invertirlas en el los gastos del hogar.
Su sueño es darle el estudio a su hijo para que se una profesional y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María works selling clothing and pupusas [a tortilla made from corn or rice, stuffed with pork cracklings, cheese and other ingredients], as well as growing corn and beans. She lives with her family, which consists of her mother who is 70 years old and her son who is 15 years old. They all depend on her business and they do not have any relatives living abroad. María sells clothing in the mornings, and in the afternoon she goes to check on and work in her fields of basic grains. In the evenings she makes and sells her pupusas.

María is requesting a loan to buy a variety of clothing, fertilizers such as manure, herbicides, pesticides and insecticides, among others. This will allow her to strengthen her business, improve her profits and use the profits for household expenses. Her dream is to give her son an education so that he can be a professional, and to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing, fertilizers such as manure, herbicides, pesticides and insecticides, among others.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La socia Juliana se dedica al negocio de venta de habas saladas,ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia trabaja desdelas 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia se dedica el negocio de 7 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar habas.

La socia esta feliz con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Juliana has a business of selling salted broad beans.  She sells in an itinerant manner from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She has been in this business for seven years, and it is going very well for her.

Her dream is to have a grocery store.

She is requesting the loan to buy broad beans.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy broad beans.

loans.name: Indira Gissell

texts.es: Gissel, es una joven de 23 años de edad, habitante del Reparto España de Managua, casada tiene un niño de 4 añitos, al que le da toda su prioridad y desea que nunca le falte nada, es por eso que ella se pone a vender cosméticos, ropa, zapatos y su esposo labora como abogado por su propia cuenta, pero en muchas ocasiones le es difícil encontrar casos que litigar y solamente se ayudan con los ingresos de Gissel es por eso que este crédito que solicita lo invertirá en el pequeño negocio con el que espera crecer y mantener un medio de ingresos más sustentable en el hogar para garantizar el buen crecimiento de su hijo.
texts.en:
Gissel is a 23 year old young woman who lives in the Reparto España of Managua. She is married and has a 4 year old son who is her highest priority: she wants to see to it that he never lacks for anything.  Consequently she has begun selling cosmetics, clothing and shoes. Her husband works on his own as a lawyer, however it is often difficult for him to find cases that go into litigation and they have to rely solely on Gissel’s earnings. 

The loan Gissel is requesting will be invested in her small business.  She hopes to expand and to maintain a more sustainable means of income for her home in order to insure the proper growth of her son.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Emae

texts.en:
Emae is 42 years old, married, and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for three years, and she earns additional income from food vending.

Emae requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF, which she will use to purchase additional grocery stock to resell. She has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF, before this loan. Emae aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery inventory to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Raghad

texts.en: Raghad is a 22-year-old single lady living with her seven siblings. Raghad is currently a student who goes to a governmental university to major in business administration. She is applying for an educational loan to pay for her next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her next semester fees.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is a 45-year-old married man with six children living in Masindi, Uganda. He practices farming and also operates a retail shop for additional income. Price fluctuation and inadequate capital to meet the high demand of his customers are affecting his business growth. His dreams are to trade in wholesale, venture into modern farming, and pay school fees for his children. Alfred intends to use the loan to pay workers who are clearing his garden and to buy seedlings for planting.

loans.use: to pay workers who are clearing his garden and buy seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Yudith

texts.en: Yudith is a 19-year-old woman and is married to Theofilus, a 21-year-old man. Yudith owns a business selling gasoline. She started this business last month with a small amount of capital. She planned to improve her business and requested a loan from TLM of 4,000,000 IDR to purchase more gasoline. She is hoping the income from this business will enable her to help her husband.

loans.use: to purchase more gasoline to resell

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina works hard to support her family. Merlina is married and has a mobile vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Merlina requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell. Merlina has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Merlina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Caryl

texts.en:
This is Caryl, 35, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Aladdin, a driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Caryl operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Caryl dreams of expanding her business and hopes that her children will finish their schooling.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 57 years old and a married mother of 6 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Emelita has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Emelita requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more clothing to sell.

Emelita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Emelita would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad lives in Pejarakan village, Buleleng, in the northern part of Bali. He lives with his wife and he has 2 children. His first child works in the city and lives there, and the second child is still in kindergarden.

Ahmad has a tailoring business at his home. He works with his wife. He needs a loan to purchase fabric and sewing tools like needles and thread. He needs a loan of 3,000,000 IDR.

Near the holiday he has a lot of orders because his customers are satisfied with his services. He hopes he can finish the orders on time. He has a plan to buy a new sewing machine to support his work.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and sewing tools

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 50 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming coconut in the Philippines. Merly is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional varieties of coconut and fertilizers.

Merly has been farming coconut for 15 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut meat. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional varieties of coconut and fertilizers

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, a fisherman for more than 20 years, lives in Bien Unido, Bohol. A married father of two children, Samuel also operates a sari-sari or variety store selling various goods.

Samuel is requesting a loan to buy fishing nets and additional stocks to sell in his store such as canned goods, candies, rice, soap, toiletries, etc. As a result, he will be able to improve his fishing and store businesses.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and addtional stocks to sell in his store like canned goods, candies, rice, soap, toiletries, etc.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
This is Anita, 51, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Mario and is the mother to their children. She and her husband are managing the household while operating the business. She continually works to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Anita operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families eat home-cooked meals only in the evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but is also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one or two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Anita's regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy more products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Anita dreams that her business will continue to grow and she hopes for continuous health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 23 years old and is a married woman with three children; two of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rosario has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Rosario requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Rosario has been in this business for four years. Rosario would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Heydi Carolina

texts.es:
La  joven Heydi  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con sus 2 hijos en una comunidad de Choluteca al  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  pulpería. 
Heydi el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  manteca,  arroz,  frijoles, carnes, azúcar, café, pan, huevos. Leches, aguas, refrescos,  etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y atender mejor  a sus clientes. 
La joven Heydi espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en una de  las pulperías más grande y reconocidas de la zona.
Heydi espera seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que  se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la vida. 	



Choluteca, Honduras  – Abril del 2013
texts.en:
The young Heydi is a responsible, hard-working, and honest person. She lives with her two children in a community of Choluteca in the south of Honduras. Her business is a small grocery store.

Heydi needs the loan for the purchase of butter, rice, beans, meat, sugar, coffee, bread, eggs, milk, water, soft drinks, etc. With the loan she hopes that her business sales increase since she will have more products to offer and to better serve her customers.

The young Heydi hopes to cover the necessities that she has and improve her and her family’s quality of life a little. In a few years, she hopes that her business continues to grow and become one of the biggest and best-known grocery stores in the area.

Heydi hopes to continue supporting her children so that they become good people with better opportunities in life.


Choluteca, Honduras – April, 2013

loans.use: to buy butter, rice, beans, meat, sugar, coffee, bread, eggs, milk, water, soft drinks, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Welina

texts.en: Welina is a 51-year-old married woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety store) and a small cafeteria in her place. This is her source of income. Welina is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, sugar, noodles, soap, toiletries and snack foods. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business and makes it a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, sugar, noodles, soap, toiletries and snack foods

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine, 25, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Juan, a driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Josephine operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to help her continue to operate her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Josephine dreams to expand her business and have more customers. She hopes that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
This is Anita. She previously accessed a 14,000 PHP loan, which she used buy school supplies to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for the family's personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy more stock of school and office supplies. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Anita hopes for the continuous success of her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for school and office supplies and products to sell in her business.

loans.name: Hedelita

texts.en:
Hedelita works hard to support her family. She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years now.

Hedelita has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her bicycle. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her bicycle

loans.name: Granito De Arena Group
