He will sell the produced sunflowers at local markets at a good price. This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to produce sunflowers.

loans.name: Black Stone Group

texts.en:
Mohamed is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mohamed was born in Waterloo 47 years ago. He is married to a trader, and the couple has two children who are attending primary and secondary schools, respectively. Mohamed sells cigarettes, sugar, batteries, milk, etc., and has been doing this business for 15 years now.

With the help of this loan, Mohamed and his group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Mohamed will use his share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leone leones) to buy the aforementioned items in bulk to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, sugar, batteries, milk, etc., in bulk to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
This marks Salim's second borrowing to purchase bales of baking flour and cooking oil for his bakery business, which has since expanded. 

His sales per day have increased greatly, and he has been able to service his previous loan successfully. He hopes to dominate his area of supply as the best baker with the most reasonable prices for baked items.

loans.use: to purchase baking flour and cooking oil for his bakery business.

loans.name: Apple Group

texts.en:
Jane, who is in her early 50s, is married with five children who are grown-ups. She has been running a catering business since 2002. She works from 8 a.m. to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Jane's 16th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start a decoration business. So, for the previous years, she has been increasing the stock of materials. She keeps on buying materials according to the color of the year. She bought more food for the catering business and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to build her house, pay school fees and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy up-to-date materials and new server dishes. Her dream is to one day be able to build another house.

Jane will share this loan with her loan group, "Apple," which has 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date materials and new serving dishes.

loans.name: Sabenty Trader 55 Group

texts.en:
Isatu is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Isatu was born in Kalmaro village, 36 years ago. She is married to a trader, and the couple has two children who are attending primary and secondary school. Isatu sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc., and has been doing this business for six years now.

With the help of this loan, Isatu and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Isatu will use her share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leon leones) to buy palm oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, etc., in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, margi seasoning, salt, pepper, etc., in bulk to add to current stock.

loans.name: Benedict

texts.en:
Benedict is still running his businesses which are doing very well. He now earns a monthly income of KES. 25,000 which he uses to support his family.
He is applying for a third business loan. He intends to use the loan to purchase a motorcycle to start a motorcycle transport business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Felton

texts.en:
This marks Felton's second loan to purchase a cow at a cheaper price to slaughter, as floods are affecting parts of the country and rendering the animals with no place to graze. 

He hopes to graze the animals for his butchery business and gain greater proceeds from their sale in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a cow for slaughter.

loans.name: Laini

texts.en:
Laini is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

Laini has operated a business selling spare parts for the past six years, selling from home to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase more spare parts for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Munkhtsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Munkhtsetseg is 50 years old and lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a rented apartment. She has been selling office supplies as well as hats, widget and shoes for thirteen years and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in the sales business. Her son will graduate from high school this year and will enroll in university. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase goods such as hats, shoes, books and pens in large quanties. As a result, she can continue to run her business without worrying about inventory shortage. Also she is contributing to the community by providing jobs by hiring two sales people at her stall. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as hats, shoes, pens and books for her market stall.

loans.name: Shazia Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a 47-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and five children. Since 2009, her husband has been running a small vegetable shop. This is the only source of income for their family. Due to an increase in the demand from the customers, Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She is the member of a 3 person group and will use the loan for the expansion of her husband's shop. With the loan investment, her husband will buy a variety of fresh vegetables that will allow him to offer more varieties to his clients and increase his sales and income. He would also build one more room to add some more space to his shop. Her husband is a very hardworking and honest man and is confident about his family’s bright future.
NOTE: In the picture Shazia is raising her hand

loans.use: to purchase variety of fresh vegetables.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya, which hosts a campus of Mt. Kenya University. She has 6 children and has been supporting them for 14 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, transportation services, and a personal farming. The photo was taken from her residential house and not from the farm.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming is selling milk. Her biggest challenge is crop failure and poor prices for farm produce. Animals on her farm have been given the name of Kageni. Josephine is requesting a loan to construct a zero grazing unit.

Josephine chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they are the best financier for farmers. Josephine learned about the importance of savings during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session.

Her highest monthly expense is school fees, and the increase in sales from this loan will allow her to pay the school fees.
As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Josephine owns a cow, pig, poultry, and a motorcycle but does not own a pump, bicycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, electricity, running water, TV, and DVD but does not have solar power or a sewing machine.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Gracious Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 48-year-old Simbiso from Masvingo. She is married with four children and two of them attend school. Simbiso runs a clothing business which sells shoes, skirts, blouses and socks. The business has been operating for 6 years. She says the main challenge being faced is of her debtors failing to pay on time. Simbiso has requested a loan of $1200 to buy tracksuits, jackets, belts and jerseys for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable her to improve the welfare of her family. In the future Simbiso plans to own a boutique shop in the city center.

loans.use: to buy tracksuits, jackets, belts and jerseys.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetable seeds to plant and to build a new greenhouse

loans.name: Artush

texts.en:
Artush is 40 years old. After graduating high school he has worked in the Ararat regional forest reserve as a forester. Artush is married and lives with his wife, two children and retired parents in Vedi city which is in the Ararat region.
Artush is also engaged in farming and animal breeding. He raises vegetables on his own plot of land near his house which he sells at the Vedi vegetable markets. Artush has a large barn for animals where he breeds two cows and piglets. Artush is the only breadwinner in his large family. His family members help him with the farming and he couldn't overcome some of the difficulties in agriculture without their support.
As Artush said it is very important to provide his animals with the best conditions. The barn must be comfortable for breeding and warm for winter months.
Artush is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders to repair the roof of his animal’s barn and to buy fodder for them. It is the first loan with Kiva and Artush thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to repair the roof of  the barn and to buy fodder for his animals.

loans.name: Zahide

texts.en:
Zahide is 31 years old and married with three children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and daughters in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. When she was 13, she started to learn to work in agriculture. Her parents were the ones who taught her to grow fruits and vegetables, since it was their only source of income. She has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than 8 years now. She sells her crops in the central bazaar to make profits in order to support her family.
Zahide’s income from her business is 350 AZN. In order to increase the living conditions of her family, she plans to expand her business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. She believes in the near future her son will help her to expand the business. Since the vegetable and fruits business is profitable and a fun business, she wants the business to continue and prosper.
Zahide needs a 1800 AZN loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and fruit trees. Her biggest wish is to offer her children an education so that they can have good careers and help their family. This is her third loan and she has a good loan history.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and fruit trees.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
This is Ruth, who is 48 years old and a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Jessie, a welder and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ruth operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Ruth hopes that her business will grow even more and dreams that her family will always stick together. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. She can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Asaf

texts.en:
Asaf is 42 years old with 2 sons. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and sons in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. From past 18 years he has been raising sheep because mutton is in high demand in this region. Asaf is a retired person with an income of 330 AZN monthly from this business. This is a very profitable business and Asaf is doing it together with his wife.
Asaf is keeping a flock of sheep in his own yard. He fattens them and takes their meat to the central bazaar, where butchers and customers purchase from him. People use mutton for traditional dishes like kababs, dolmas, pilovs, etc.
He has taken loan from Aqroinvest before and has a good loan history. This is going to be his 2nd loan. This time he requires 1600 AZN in order to purchase 12 sheep in order to sell more meat in summer. He is optimistic about this loan, because in summer more people consume meat, due to the holidays and increased customers in restaurants.

loans.use: to purchase 12 sheep in order to sell more meat in summer.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children and all of them attend school. She is not looking after any additional family members.
She has been operating a pub for five years, working a full week. She also operates an eating-place for additional income.
She has requested for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more crates of beer, soda, spirits and local brew. Her challenges include recovering money from clients who buy on credit and also seasonality. Her dream is to expand her business to a bigger pub, thus creating more employment and also to build her own house. She joined MCDT because she did not have to give collateral in order to access loans. She rents a house with access to electricity and no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer, soda, spirits and local brew.

loans.name: Rafeela Group

texts.en:
Rafeela is a 24-year-old responsible mother of two children. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along her husband and children in a rented house. Her husband has run a garment shop for five years and this is the only source of income for her family. Her household expenses are very large compared to the business income, because she is facing a lot of financial problems in life.
As a member of a two person group, Rafeela has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount her husband would buy new varieties of dresses, shirts, jeans, and suits to attract more customers. His sales would increase and his monthly income and savings would also be increased. With the profit amount Rafeela would purchase her own house.
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for helping her. NOTE: In the picture Rafeela is raising her hand.

loans.use: to purchase dresses and clothes for the garment shop.

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en:
Mouhammad is from Iraq, he is 32 years old and lives with his brothers. Mouhammad and 2 of his brothers provide the income for his parents.
Mouhammad is a grocer and has been doing this since 2010. Mouhamamd offers various products for his clients like smokes, milk products and detergents. He has gained good experience and has been gradually growing with fame and respect in the area.
Mouhammad is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to install a display window. Mouhammad aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may take a better care of his parents.

loans.use: to install a display window.

loans.name: Vènan André

texts.fr: Vènan André est âgé de 52 ans et est marié à Antoinette. Le couple a sept enfants dont certains scolarisés. Vènan André vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Vènan André n’a pas fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la couture. Vènan André exerce ce métier depuis trente ans ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. En vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Vènan André sollicite pour la quatrième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits précédemment obtenus ont tous été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Vènan André is 52 years old and married to Antoinette.  The couple has seven children, some of whom go to school.  Vènan André lives with his wife and children and covers the family's various expenses with his wife.

Vènan André did not go to school.  Instead, he learned to sew.  He has been working as a tailor for the past 30 years, an activity which allows him to meet the needs of his family.  In order to meet the demand from his customers, he is requesting financial support from ALIDé for the fourth time.  His previous loans were all duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Khurelpurev

texts.en:
Mr. Khurelpurev, 24 years-old, lives with his mother, wife and son in Ulaanbaatar the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a waiter at a pub since 2010 and during his free time, he provides a taxi service to local people.

His mother has a position of a senior professional at a health center and his wife is currently staying at home looking after their baby. Recently his old automobile, which had been repaired earlier using his previous loan, stopped working completely so he is requesting a loan of 2000000 MNT in order to purchase an electric car. Electric cars contribute to cleaner air in cities because they produce no harmful pollution at the tailpipe from the onboard source of power, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. From personal views, purchasing of this type of car should be encouraged everywhere because Ulaanbaatar has the worst air pollution in the world. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase an electric car.

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif is 35 years-old. He is the father of two daughters.  He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and daughters in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. 

He has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 12 years. He chose this business because it is profitable and because there is always a high demand for fresh crops. People use fresh vegetables every day and include them in many national dishes, such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served at every family table in Azerbaijan and are often made into fresh punch. 

Asif  sells his crops at the BIlasuvar central bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN. His wife actively helps him to raise his crops. Asif  also receives a pension.

As his products are in high demand, Asif wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables in order to satisfy market demand. For this purpose, he has applied for a loan in the amount of 1700 AZN. He will buy seeds and fertilizers with his loan funds. This will be his third  loan and he has a positive loan history.

loans.use: to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand.

loans.name: Viasity Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Viasity group’’. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of SLL 500,000.00 for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Ada is the featured leader of this group. Ada is 41-years-old and married with three children – one in primary school and two in secondary school. She sells cigarettes, soap, tooth-pastes, batteries, etc. and has been doing this business for eight years now. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying the above items in large quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, soap, tooth-pastes, batteries, etc. in large quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.name: La Gloria Group

texts.es:
La Gloria es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 8 personas, este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una comunidad que está rodeada por sembradíos de caña de azúcar. Además, muy cerca se encuera un río muy bonito que en verano es visitado por personas de diferentes comunidades. 

Doña Rosa es uno de los integrantes de dicho grupo, ella se ha dedicado a la elaboración de dulces típicos de su región(cocadas, jamoncillos y dulces de leche) por mas de 30 años, y dice que en sus inicios fue muy difícil ya que no sabia como elaborarlos pero tenia la intención de trabajar para salir adelante con su hijo ya que era madre soltera, así que pidió a  su hermana que le ensañara a realizar los dulces, aprendió muy rápido  y poco a poco fue haciendo buenos clientes, Doña Rosa realiza sus ventas fuera de su comunidad en lugares cercanos, ademas comenta que se siente muy contenta con su actividad ya que ha sido tradición familiar ya que la primera en elaborar estos dulces fue su abuela y ha pasado este oficio por dos generaciones.
Un préstamo de VisionFund le ayudará a comprar cocos, azúcar, ajonjolí, leche y colorantes para la elaboración de sus dulces.

Doña Rosa también realiza pequeñas ventas de ropa para obtener un ingreso extra y espera con sus ganancias hacer algunas remodelaciones a su hogar y si quedara un poco iniciar un ahorro para lo que se presente.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
 
Teodora venta de ropa 
Rolando venta de refrescos
Zuleima venta de calzado 
Ana Luisa venta de cosmeticos
Irma venta de comida 
Angelica venta de dulces
Odalis venta de ropa
texts.en:
This eight-member group is called "La Gloria" and is based in a community surrounded by sugar cane fields.  Nearby there there is also a very pretty river which is visited by people various different areas.

Rosa is one member of  "La Gloria".  For thirty years she has made a living producing typical sweet products from the region (such as "cocadas", coconut sweets, "jamoncillos", fudge, and "dulce de leche").  Rosa tells us that in the beginning the work was difficult as she did not know how to make the sweets. However, a single mother, she wanted to work in order that she and her son could prosper so she asked her sister to teach her how to make the sweets.  Rosa learned very quickly and, little by little, she gained good customers.  Rosa goes out to sell in nearby communities and tells us she is very happy with her work as it is a family tradition.  The first person in her family to start making sweets was her grandmother and the skills have now been passed on to two generations.

A Vision Fund loan will help Rosa to buy coconuts, sugar, sesame seeds, milk and colouring for making her sweets.

Rosa also makes a few sales of clothes in order to have an extra income.  She hopes that, with her profits, she will be able to do some renovations to her home and any leftover money she will save for a rainy day.

The other members of the group:

Teodora - sells clothes
Rolando - sells drinks
Zuleima - sells footwear
Ana Luisa - sells make-up
Irma - sells food
Angelica - sells sweets
Odalis - sells clothes.

loans.use: to make and sell typical sweets products.

loans.name: Reyes Elias

texts.es: Don reyes vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos; el se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, el comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable. Reyes es una hombre  dedicado a su labor,  quiere aprovechar el auge de su negocio para aumentar la producción y así poder tener mejores ganancias, necesita invertir en insumos pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, insecticida, herramienta, etc. para obtener mejores cosechas y  a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en: Reyes lives with his partner and two children.  He makes a living in agriculture growing corn and beans.  He has many years experience in this work and his experience is very valuable as it allows him to get better harvests.  The land Reyes cultivates is in an area where there is a lot of agricultural work.  Reyes goes out to the neighbouring areas to sell his products and he now has a strong customer base.  Customers always prefer Reyes' products as they are of good quality and sold at accessible prices; you also can't beat the customer service.  Reyes is dedicated to his work and wants to take advantage of the boom in his business to increase production and thus earn higher profits.  To do this, he needs to invest in supplies but requires capital and so is applying for a loan that will allow him to buy corn, beans, manure, insecticide, tools and more.  This will give him better harvests and, at the same time, Reyes is confident that, with this investment, he will be able to give his family what they deserve.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilisers, seeds and more.

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Ángela habita   en la ciudad de Estelí ella tiene una pulpería la cual empezó con mucho sacrificio ella comenzó con un poco de dinero que tenía ahorrado y otro poco que le dio su esposo compró arroz y azúcar eso fueron los primeros productos luego la gente le iba comprando más y entonces fue creciendo su negocio en pulpería ha sido su primer negocio pero ya tenía experiencia en ventas ya que se dedicaba a la venta de cosméticos doña Ángela necesita este crédito por que sus clientes han aumentado y va a comprar arroz ,azúcar, aceite ,frijoles ,harina, maíz, gaseosas papel higiénico y otros productos.  
Sus planes futuro son ampliar su negocio y que sea la venta más grande del barrio donde haya de todo un poco  sus planes futuros son hacer los cuartos de su casa para que sus únicos dos hijos tengan  un techo digno donde vivir, sus hijos cuando ellos no están en la escuela la apoyan en la venta ella cree que este crédito le va ayudar ya que va surtir y saldrá adelante con sus clientes sus únicos ingresos son lo que hace en el negocio y la ayuda de su esposo.
texts.en:
Ángela lives in the city of Estelí and has a small grocery store.  She started it with a lot of sacrifice and a little money that she had saved and a little more that her husband gave her.  With this money, Ángela bought rice and sugar and these were the first products that she sold.  Later on people started buying more and her business began to grow.  This was Ángela's first business but she had previous experience in sales as before she made a living selling make-up.  Ángela needs this loan because her number of customers has increased and she is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, flour, corn, fizzy drinks, toilet paper and other products.

Ángela's future plan is to expand the business and to have the highest sales in the barrio, where there are all sorts of shops.  Ángela also wants to make rooms in her house so that her only two children can have a decent place to live.  When they are not at school, her children help their mother with sales.  Ángela thinks that this loan will help her to stock-up and to prosper with her customers.  Ángela's only income comes from the business and from her husband.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, flour, corn, fizzy drinks, toilet paper and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta  vive junto a su esposo y su  hijos de 4 años de edad en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden y al gusto de los clientes; ella es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora día con día se esfuerza al máximo para ganarse una vida mejor y un gran éxito para el futuro, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso  solicita un crédito que le permita comprar ropa: camisas, faldas, ropa para  niños, blusas, etc. y asi surtir su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y tener la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: This client lives with her husband and her 4 year old kids in their own house. She works selling clothes and has been running this business for some years and this has given her the experience to make a better income. The business is located in her place of residence. She has many customers as people know that all her goods are high quality at affordable prices and that she offers unequaled service - always meeting the orders and tastes of her customers. She is a very enterprising woman who is very dedicated to her work and she strives hard. Day in and day out, she works herself to the maximum to achieve a better life and great success for the future. Demand for her products has increased in recent weeks and she wants to take advantage by buying more stock, but she doesn't have enough capital to make this possible. So, she is requesting a loan to buy more clothing: shirts, skirts, children's clothes, blouses, etc, and in this way to supply her store in order to make the best profits and to have the hope that she can bring her household greater economic security.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk: skirts, blouses, children's clothes, etc.

loans.name: Arcoíris Group

texts.es: En el Banco Comunal Arcoíris, ubicado en Concepción VII región de Chile, participan socios que tienen negocios como lavado de autos, ventas de queso, taller mecánico, venta de mariscos congelados, peluquería y amasandería, y nuestra entrevistada, Carolina, que está ubicada al medio de la foto de chaqueta negra y sonriendo aparece junto a un hombre de gorro amarillo; ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa nueva, viaja a Santiago a comprar por encargo. Ella comenzó su negocio de una forma muy particular, cuando tenía 17 años su padre le regalo 500.000 mil pesos, y viajo con su hermano a Santiago a conocerlo, y compro algunas cosas en el Barrio Patronato, cuando llego a su casa vendió tanto que así empezó a ir a Santiago y comprar a pedido, a los 19 años dejo de trabajar en eso por el nacimiento de su hijo, pero el año pasado comenzó nuevamente a vender ropa. Lo malo de este negocio, nos cuenta, es cuando uno vende ropa, pero la gente no paga, ese ha sido uno de sus mayores problemas, por lo que en su regreso a la venta de ropa ha decidido solo comprar a la gente que le encarga y paga sin problemas. En este ciclo le irá muy bien, ya que tiene asegurada la venta de la ropa que compre. Además agrega que lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar con Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de que la asesoren y aconsejen, y la seguridad que le entregan como institución.
texts.en: The community bank Arcoíris (Rainbow) is located in the Concepcíon VII region of Chile. The group's members have businesses such as a car wash, a cheese seller, an auto mechanic, a fish seller, a hairdresser, and a bakery. Our interviewee, Carolina, is located in the middle of the photo wearing a black jacket and smiling. She is next to a man in a yellow cap. She has a business selling new clothes. She travels to Santiago to buy in bulk. She began her business in a very particular way: when she was 17 years old, her father loaned her $1,000 and she traveled with her brother to Santiago to explore the city. She bought some things in the Patronato neighborhood and when she got home, she sold them all. This is how she began to go to Santiago and buy clothes to order. When she was 19, she stopped working because of the birth of her son. But, last year she began to sell clothes again. She tells us that the bad thing about this business is when she sells clothes to people that don't pay. This has been one of her biggest problems. So, when she came back to selling clothes, she decided to only buy for the people who place orders and pay without problems. In this local cycle, things are going very well as she has assured the sale of the clothes she buys. She adds that, what she has most liked about working with Fondo Esperanza is the fact that they give her advice and counsel and the security that they offer as an institution.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Farhiya

texts.en:
Farhiya is married to her husband, who is a driver, and they have five children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.
Farhiya has operated a charcoal selling business for the past year, selling from home to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.
With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: Doña Matilde de 47 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz y sorgo desde hace 10 años, también cuando ha pasado la cosecha  se dedica  a vender tamales en las colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, vive con su esposo y sus  4  hijos de 18, 15, 12 y 10 años de edad, es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a su familia, doña Matilde esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar fertilizantes, semillas, abonos  y herramientas para su cultivo de maíz y sorgo para obtener mejores cosechas y darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: 47 year old Matilde works growing corn and sorghum and has been doing this for 10 years. When the harvest is over, she also works selling tamales in the settlements that are close to her home. She lives with her husband and her 4 children who are 18, 15, 12, and 10 years old. She is a hardworking person and very responsible about her household obligations. She has always been known for providing the best for her family. Matilde is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, seed, and tools for her corn and sorghum crops so that she can get better harvests and give her family what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Wenceslao

texts.es: Wenceslao  es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa, el  se dedica a ser agricultor siembra maíz y maicillo también se dedica  a la pesca artesanal,  sus cosechas las vende en las comercios de compra-venta de granos básicos con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos  gastos de su hogar. Wenceslao desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso ha solicitado un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, entre otras cosas, para seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en: Wenceslao is a man who is very responsible about his household obligations and has always been known as a man who offers his family the best. He currently lives with his wife and he is a farmer who grows corn and sorghum and he is also engaged in fishing. He sells his harvests to the merchants who deal in staple crops. With the profit that he makes from his sales, he is able to cover some of his household expenses. Wenceslao wants to increase his sales and so he is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers among other things so that he can keep putting bread on the table every day.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seed, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Husniyya

texts.en:
Husniyya is 26 years old and a mother of 2 children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and daughters in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 5 years. She chose this business because it is profitable and because there is always a high demand for fresh crops. People use fresh vegetables every day and include them in many national dishes, such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served at every family’s table in Azerbaijan and are often made into fresh punch.

Husniyya sells her crops at the Bilasuvar central bazaar. Her monthly income is 150 AZN. Her husband actively helps her to raise her crops.

As her products are in high demand, Husniyya wants to expand her business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover the market demand. For this purpose, she has applied for a loan in the amount of 1800 AZN. She will buy seeds and fertilizers with her loan funds. This will be her third loan and she has a positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to grow more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy jeans, shoes, dresses, and t-shirts.

loans.name: Chokumirira Hapana Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 41-year-old Judith from Masvingo. She is a single mother with three children; all of them are attending school. She also cares for four dependents. Judith runs a clothing business which sells dresses, shoes, jeans and t-shirts. The business has been in operation for 14 years. She says the main challenge she is facing is that her goods are sometimes stolen from her site during the night. Judith has requested a loan of $500 to buy dresses, jeans, shoes and t-shirts. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable her to pay up the school fees for all her children and also to improve the welfare of her family. In the future Judith plans to operate a transport business.

loans.use: to buy dresses, shoes, t-shirts and jeans.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children, all of whom attend school. She is also looking after her mother.
She has been operating a retail shop for fifteen years, working seven days a week. She also practices farming for additional income.
She has requested for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her purchase sugar, cooking oil, flour, salt, rice, dry beans, groundnuts, peas, and soda for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to be able to own a big wholesale shop. She joined MCDT because her friends told her about the relatively low interest on loans. She stays in her own house with access to electricity and no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soap, salt, cooking oil, dry beans, groundnuts, peas, soda, flour and rice for her shop.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married woman. She lives with her husband in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water.

She has operated a kiosk retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Neris Abidio

texts.es: Don neri de 47 años de edad  es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su familia en casa propia. El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela en la que siembra maíz y sorgo,  sus productos son de muy buena calidad y la parcela está ubicada en una zona de fácil acceso lo que es muy bueno para él porque le beneficia que sus clientes puedan llegar inmediatamente hasta el lugar.  Don neri  solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga, fertilizantes, semillas, abonos, etc.  para iniciar la siembra cuanto antes. Neri ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una  mejor calidad d vida
texts.en: 47 year old Neri is very friendly and hardworking. He lives with his family in their own house. He works very hard on his own land on which he grows corn and sorghum. His produce is very high quality and his land is located in an area with easy access which is very good for him because customers can go right to where he grows. Neri is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so that he'll have the money he needs to buy agricultural supplies such as pesticides, fertilizers, seeds, etc, for the next crop he sows. Neri is eager to increase his sales in order to make a better income and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Gene

texts.en:
Gene is 54 years old and married with three children.

Gene is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Gene requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gene has been farming rice and sugarcane for eight years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF, and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Active Traders Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Active Traders group from Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. They are petty-businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to request a loan of 500,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their respective businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Kadiatu is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone, 25 years ago. She is married to a businessman, and the two have two children. She has been selling for two years now. She sells onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy more of the aforementioned items to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy onions, margi seasoning, salt, pepper, etc., to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Job

texts.en:
Job is a 55-year-old businessman from Matuu. He is a shoemaker, a business he has operated for the past three years. He also does tailoring to supplement his income. He is married to Ruth. Job earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second business loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying a previous loan. He will use the loan to purchase a new motorcycle to start a motorcycle transport business. He will use the proceeds from the business to invest in his tailoring business. He hopes to have a well sustained family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to start a transport business

loans.name: Nazem

texts.en:
Nazem is an Iraqi client, who is 38 years old, married and has 5 children. Nazem is the sole provider for the family.
Nazem is a cowman and owns a small farm. At his farm, Nazem raises cows, milks them and prepares dairy products from that milk. He has been practicing this business since 2004 and has gained good experience in this field. Thanks to the fresh and good quality of his products, Nazem has become well-known in the market.
Nazem is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to buy a new cow in order to increase his productions. Nazem believes that this loan will change his current financial conditions and will grant him the ability to take a better care of his family.

loans.use: to buy a new cow to increase milk production.

loans.name: Faida

texts.en:
For the past years, she has operated a charcoal selling business and has sold cereals. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is high cost of transportation to her place of operation.
With the loan she is requesting of KES 30,000 she wants to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale and more cereals. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support granted.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale and more cereals.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years.

Mercedita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like sardines, shampoo, diapers and other miscellaneous items.

In the future, Mercedita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like sardines, shampoo, diapers and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Don juan se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra maicillo y maiz y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su esposa. Juan  esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, etc. ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Juan has been engaged in farming for several years.  He plants sorghum and corn and from the sales of his crops, he manages to pay his household expenses.  He is a responsible, honest, and hardworking man.  He lives with his wife.  Juan is requesting a loan to purchase inputs for his crops such as fertilizer, organic fertilizer, and seeds because what he is earning is not enough to cover these expenses.  In this way, he will have higher income and better financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide.

loans.name: Batkhishig

texts.en: Mr. Batkhishig, 39 years old, lives alone in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a guardian at a private business entity where his elder brother has the position of auditor. The ger he lives in has been flooded with rain water recently, and the materials used for building the ger, such as planks and felt, became badly deteriorated. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase a five-walled Mongolian traditional ger. This five-walled ger is way better than his previous ger in comfort by providing more space and warmth by preserving heat, especially during the wintertime. He will use less coal for fuel and contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a five-walled Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling).

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She does not look after any additional family members. She has been operating a retail shop from home for the last six years, working seven days a week. 

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings to enable her to purchase trays of eggs, sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, salt and crates of soda for sale. She has no other source of income. She joined MCDT because of the easy terms for joining. Her main challenges include limited capital. 

She would like to have a big shop stocked with all basic commodities and accumulate profits to buy land. She is renting a house with electricity and no piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, salt and crates of soda.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
This is Letecia, 41, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Joel, a welder, and is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Letecia operates a room rental business; it is rented on a monthly basis. She also has a variety store. She earns a minimum of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every month.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan for the repair and maintenance of her room for rent. She will also buy grocery products for her business.

Letecia dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the renovation of her rental apartment and to buy grocery items for her variety store.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar lives with her mother and brother in Artashat town, and jointly with them, runs a farm. Their farm currently includes 15 chickens; they also cultivate barley and grow apricot, plum, apple and pear trees. The gathered harvest is sold locally, and this agricultural income is the only one for Gohar and her family.

Despite her young age (35 years), Gohar has 11 years of experience in the agricultural field, and she runs her farm with great love and pleasure. Having no financial means for expanding her agricultural business, Gohar has decided to apply to SEF International for the loan. With the loan's help, Gohar will be able to purchase little chickens and forage for feeding them. This will enable Gohar and her family to expand their farming business and gather more income, which is very important for sustaining the family.

loans.use: to pay for little chickens and forage for feeding them.

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
Adam is 22 years old and from Gaza. He has owned a clothing shop for selling clothes since 2009.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a glass door and enlarge the space of his clothing shop. This loan will help Adam display more clothes and thus, increase his sales and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a glass door and enlarge the space of his clothing shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy spare parts for selling at a profit.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Akuegnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AKUEGNON est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Jeannette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Jeannette est âgée de 31 ans. Jeannette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Jeannette est mariée à un certain Pascal. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Jeannette vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Pour ce faire, Jeannette vend de la bouillie, des beignets (à base de blé) et des crevettes de façon ambulante depuis quinze ans. Jeannette s’approvisionne dans un un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Jeannette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AKUEGNON, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The "Akuegnon" group comprises four people who live in the same area. The group leader, Jeannette, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. Jeannette is 31 years old and did not attend school. She is married to a man named Pascal. The couple have four children, all in school and in the care of their parents. Jeannette lives with her husband and children. The couple provide for the family together. In order to do this, Jeannette has sold bouillie (a cereal-based dish), beignets (made of wheat), and shrimp door-to-door for fifteen years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. With the goal of satisfying her clientele and increasing her sales volume and income, Jeannette is seeking a fourth loan with ALIDÉ, along with the other members of the Akuegnon group. The previous loans were repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, vegetable oil, and shrimp

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 37 years old. She has been running a retail shop for the past 12 years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 that she uses to support her family. She is applying for her second loan after repaying her previous loans successfully. 

She will use the loan to purchase sugar, rice, tissue papers, sweets, green grams, etc., for her retail shop. She intends to plough back the income earned from her business to start a new business. Her hopes and dreams are to own her own wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, tissue papers, sweets, green grams.

loans.name: Benta

texts.en:
Benta is married and has five children, two of whom attend school while three graduated from school and are working. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a dried fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also does farming, which earns her another source of livelihood. 

She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of becoming a major supplier of dried fish in the near future.

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase two sacks of dried fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children and all of them attend school. She is also looking after two of her sisters. She stays with her husband in a rented house with access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

She has been selling green bananas from the market at retail for 1 1/2 years, working six days a week. She also sells vegetables like tomatoes as another source of income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more bunches of green bananas. 

Her challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to acquire a truck to help her in the transportation of green bananas from the farms, and also to build her own house  

She joined MCDT because she did not have capital to start a meaningful business.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Qiniso

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 32-year-old Qiniso from Bulawayo. She is single and has two children, one attending school.  

Qiniso runs a retail business selling clothes and footwear for both children and adults. The business has been in operation for four years. She says the main challenges are lack of working capital and competition from larger retailers. 

Qiniso has requested a loan of $500 to purchase more stock for the coming winter season. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to pay school fees and cover other household expenses. In the future Qiniso plans to open a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase more trading stock.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is married and has children who all attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past years, he has owned a retail shop business, where neighbors and town dwellers are his potential customers. He faces a major challenge of fluctuations in number of clients leading to the loss of perishable goods.

With the KES 30,000, he wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat. He dreams of expanding the business to a modern café. He again gives thanks to Yehu and Kiva for the help.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Akovognon

texts.fr: Akovognon est âgé de 38 ans et est marié à une coiffeuse du nom de Émilienne. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains sont scolarisés. Akovognon vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Akovognon et sa femme assurent ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Akovognon n’a pas fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la couture. En vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Akovognon sollicite pour la deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Le crédit antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Akovognon is 38 years old and married to a hairstylist named Émilienne. The couple have three children, some of whom attend school. Akovognon lives together with his wife and children. He and his wife provide for the family together. Akovognon did not attend school, but learned how to make clothes. With the goal of satisfying the demands of his clientele, he is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ for the second time. The previous loan was repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies and an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Sarvinoz

texts.en: Sarvinoz is 24 years old. She is married and has one child. She wants to provide her child with a good quality of life. Two months ago, Sarvinoz started a new animal husbandry business as she lives in a village and has some experience with animal husbandry. Sarvinoz completed the course "To Get Ahead" for women starting organizations and learned enough business skills. Her husband will help her with the business. She will be a very successful businesswoman as she is hardworking and smart. Sarvinoz requests a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy cattle to develop her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Laxon

texts.en:
Laxon is married and has one child, who attends school. His wife, Mary, is a housewife and she contributes to meet the family's basic needs.

Laxon has operated a mechanics business for the past five years. His neighbors and other motor vehicles owners are his potential clients. In addition, he also operates a food selling business, which brings him another source of livelihood. 

With the loan of KES 20,000 he is requesting, he wants to purchase spare parts for his business to meet his customers' demands. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his business.

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania is 56 years old and married with two children.

Melania works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Melania has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for eight years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Melania aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Davide

texts.en:
Davide is back again and in need for another loan. She wants to invest in an irrigation pump to water the planted field. 

Her region and the village where she resides suffered from severe flooding all these past months; however, the residents hope that from now on the weather will be stable and they will be able to plant even though a bit late this time.

Davide purchased sows with the previous loan "thanks to the lenders," she said, smiling." Without their help, I would not be able to achieve what I achieved, despite my desire to do something. So again, thanks a lot to all of you who supported me and who support people in need like myself," was her last phrase.

loans.use: To buy an irrigation pump.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 57 years old and is married with 6 children.  

Norma is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Norma requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Norma has been farming rice for 15 years now, and has borrowed 27 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Norma would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 47-year-old hardworking woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, three sons and five daughters. Three of her children are currently studying in primary school. Abida's husband is a laborer, but his income is not enough to meet the household expenses.

Abida is a very hardworking and responsible woman. By stitching clothes, she helps her husband meet the family's needs and her children's educational expenses. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly for the past 15 years, and her clients always appreciate her work.

Abida has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, she will be purchasing a new sewing machine so that she can work more efficiently in the future and her production could be increased. As she is living in a rented house with her family, she dreams to build her own house. She also desires to expand her business and to provide a quality education to her children. With the profit amount, she will pay her house rent. Abida and her family are very much thankful to both BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Serious Women Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the Serious Women group from Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 500,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Kadiatu is the featured leader of this group. The 36-year-old is a native of Makonkarie village. She is married to a trader, and they have three children who are attending primary and secondary school. Kadiatu has been a businesswoman for many years now; she sells charcoal. With her share of this loan, she will buy a large quantity of charcoal to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of charcoal to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Jecintar

texts.en:
Jecintar is a married mother of three who lives in the Mukuru informal settlement of Nairobi, Kenya. She currently works as a textile retailer at the nearby Gikomba market. Due to the need for sanitation facilities at the market -- the largest open-air market in the country -- Jecintar would like to purchase two Fresh Life toilets.

Jecintar's main goals are to provide a sanitation solution in the market area and to establish herself as a successful entrepreneur. She intends to use the profits from this business to fund her children's education and buy her own house. Jecintar's dream is to be known as the pioneer of Fresh Life toilets in the Gikomba area.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres y hermanos  actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar almacigo de café para sembrarlo en una pequeña ´propiedad de la familia,, el desea dar asistencia a este cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , y así obtener mayores ganancias y tener una mejor calidad de vida , ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Antonio, an enterprising man, is 33, single, and lives with his parents and siblings at the moment. He is requesting a loan with the desire to buy coffee seedlings to plant on a small plot of family land. He wants to maintain these coffee crops in order to keep them in good condition during their development and obtain a product of good quality. This will earn a higher profit and provide him and his family with a better quality of life. They depend on this work. For this reason, Antonio is requesting a loan. This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has not had previous loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with greater ease and lower much interest rates.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Remember We Group

texts.en:
Ramatu is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Ramatu was born 38 years ago in one of the villages that make up Sanda. She is married to a trader and the couple has 3 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Ramatu sells body lotions, soaps, sprays, toothpastes, etc. and has been doing this business for 6 years now.

With the help of this loan, Ramatu and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Ramatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy body lotions, soaps, sprays, toothpastes, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy body lotions, soaps, sprays, toothpastes, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Sadaf Group

texts.en: Sadaf is a 28-year-old, hardworking and diligent woman. Her husband is a video recorder and makes movies for marriages. He has been doing this work for 9 years. He is a very skilled and expert movie maker and his clients are very well satisfied with his work. Currently, he requires a high resolution movie camera to make the best quality movies. For that purpose, Sadaf has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, as a member of 3 person group. Her husband will purchase a new camera so he can do his work with more efficiency in the future. This would also increase the net income and savings. Sadaf is very hopeful for this loan as this could solve many of their financial problems.With the profit amount, Sadaf would pay her household expenses. NOTE: In the picture, Sadaf is raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a new movie camera

loans.name: Ozodamo

texts.en:
Ozodamo is a kind and smart woman. Gany is her husband. They have two children they love very much. They live together in a big house.

She sells a variety of children's clothes. She stores her merchandise at the local market. She acquires her goods in shopping centers in the city. She makes periodic trips to accomplish her goal. She began working this way some years ago because she needed to earn money. Currently, her sister helps her to purchase her merchandise.  She is asking for a loan of 2,800 USD to buy children's clothes for new season.

This is her first loan with IMON, and she promises to make payments on time. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes for the new season

loans.name: Blessed Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 42-year-old Jeshua from Masvingo. Jeshua is married with two children and both are attending school.  Jeshua runs a retail business which sells face powders, facial lotions, bangles, hair extensions. The business has been in operation for six years. He says the main challenge being faced is that of low volume of stock of the products in demand. 

Jeshua has requested a loan of $700 to buy face powders, facial lotions, hair extensions and bangles. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable him to improve the welfare of his family. In the future Jeshua plans to build his own shop.

loans.use: to buy face powders, facial lotions, bangles, and hair extensions

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 56 years old and single. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Sylvia is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Sylvia has been farming sugarcane for eleven years and also earns additional income from her general store and from fattening pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her extended family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda is 50 years old. She is married and has two children who are adults. For some years, she has wanted to organize her own business. Mavluda dedicated herself to realizing her plan. She started a new business selling dried fruits three months ago. She studied at the course of ‘To Get Ahead’ in the women's organization and got enough skills about business. She manages the business alone. She sells her goods at the local market. 

She wants to increase her working capital and develop new business. In this way, she wants to maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 somoni to buy dried fruits. She will use her loan and her business to be a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy dried fruits for developing a new business.

loans.name: Atipashe Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 39-year-old Livison from Masvingo. He is married with three children and two are attending school. Livison runs a retail business which sells groceries and plough wheels. The business has been in operation for 16 years. He says the main challenge being faced is that of his debtors failing to pay on time. Livison has requested a loan of 1,500 USD to purchase sugar, cooking oil, mealie meal and maize seed for resale. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable him to improve the welfare of his family. In the future, Livison plans to buy a house in town.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, cooking oil, mealie meal and maize seed

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a lady of 38 years. She is single and a mother of two children. She sells clothes in Limuru. Rose has been in the business for six years, and she gets a monthly income of 10,000 shillings.
 
This will be Rose's second loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase clothes for sale. She plans to use the profits to pay back the loan and plow back into her business. In the future, she wants to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is married. He is a father of one and lives in Kisauni. He services motor vehicles and sells spare parts. John is a very hardworking and enterprising man who says that he has been able to greatly increase his income and help his family, thanks to his hard work.

He always struggles to improve his mechanic workshop, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. John is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy work tools for his mechanics shop in order to do his work efficiently.

loans.use: to buy work tools for his mechanics shop.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 14,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Teresita dreams that her business will grow even more and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Zulekha

texts.en: Zulekha is a married mother of three who lives in Kisauni. With the help of her family, she sells fruit juices. Zulekha is a very enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work. She always struggles to improve her fruit parlor, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Zulekha is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to buy mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw fruits for the preparation of juices.

loans.use: to buy mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw fruits

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a single woman with two children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Sophia has operated a bookshop business for the past eight years. She sells to her neighbors and house constructors who come to buy from her. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase textbooks and exercise books for sale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a wholesale bookshop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase textbooks and exercise books for sale.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah operates a tree nursery and flower business, selling to agricultural farms and forest industries. She also sells coconuts, which provide her other source of livelihood. She cites seasonality and stiff competition from other flower operators as her major challenge. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, Serah wants to pay school fees for her children. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 51 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Wilma is borrowing 29,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feeds and medicines for her pigs.

Wilma has been raising pigs for 28 years and also earns additional income from selling seafood.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Qamile

texts.en: Qamile is a previous Kiva client who used lenders' financial help to purchase a washing machine. She is now applying for another little loan of 50,000 Albanian lek (ALL) to add a refrigerator. "Maybe this is a little thing to some people, but this is a big one for me; it's a luxury," Qamile said. "I am very happy now to have the washing machine. It made my life easier, because before I had to wash everything by hand. I can't wait to get a refrigerator to store my grandchildren's food. I want to thank everyone who supported me financially, all those kind and generous lenders that felt for me."

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 48-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her family. She is a mother of 8 children and a responsible and hardworking housewife. Her husband has a construction material supplies business. Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. With the help of the loan, her husband will purchase bricks, cement, and other construction materials and then sell them for a profit in the main market. By doing so, he is confident that he will easily increase his net income and savings for the future. Parveen is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her husband's business. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Sobira

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Sobira works hard to support her family. She has a clothing sales business in Tajikistan, and she has had this business for a year and earns income to provide her family with all the necessary things. 

 Sobira works hardly from early morning till late night. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money. In the future, Sobira hopes to improve her business in order to provide for the education of her children.

Sobira is asking for a loan of 4000 somoni to buy children's clothes for the new season. She hopes that this loan will help her to improve her business and her biggest dream will come true: “To be a rich business lady”.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes for the new season

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has operated a business of selling palm leaves for thatching houses for the past one year. In addition she also sells firewood which earns her another source of livelihood. She sells to her neighbors and house constructors who come to buy from her. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase palm leaves and add to her savings and purchase a motorcycle for a transport business.  She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establishing a wholesale shop for selling palm leaves in the near future. Once more she appreciates the help.

loans.use: to purchase palm leaves and add to her savings to purchase a motorcycle for a transport business.

loans.name: God Is Great Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “God Is Great” group from Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city.
